column5: Good morning everyone. Just wondering if someone could tell me the conditions this morning. (or as of last night).  Worried about the hut blowing away, and dont really have time to go check. (and not sure if its good for the sled) I'll make the trip if I have to.  Thanks to everyone!!    Ciao  Matt.
If your hut is not securely anchored I'd be concerned.
Is the wind blowing in Canada???  ... how unusual!!!  We got some pretty big winds here yesterday, I can imagine how they're going to be up there today!
Only calling for 20K here today. 2C this morning though. Rained all night.
Very strong winds and gusts here in Stroud, so unless your hut is well anchored it may be on the other side of the lake  John

Thats what I figured.  Well I just returned from Alcona, Didn't make the trek, but other hutsI could see from the launch seemed to be staying put.  Fixing the sled today, so I'll take a rip after work tomorrow with fingers crossed. Hopefully it just flips over, and stays put.  Thanks for the responses!!

went out of Beaverton this am to aNchor our hut . walked out thru 2" + of water , Cleats are a must . Trucks,sleds and atvs still on the ice.  Hut was still where we left it , but also got it anchored .All surrounding huts seemed secure . The snow and cooling temps should settle everyting down  TB

How's the access from the west side of the lake?  Is there still plenty of ice?  I am planning some ice fishing for 'family day' and don't want to drive all the way there for nothing...  How's the perch bite?

Not sure about the Bite . but lots of ice . Come on out Saturday for Tylers event at Innsifil park. Great day for the kids.  Plan on stopping by the park on friday for a look see , will let everyone know.  TB
